intro: Psychotria pongoana, commonly known as the Pongoan Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Psychotria pongoana is often found in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
